thread.title: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan paves way for record 90,000 Wembley crowd at Joshua-Klitschko fight
thread.title_full: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan paves way for record 90,000 Wembley crowd at Joshua-Klitschko fight

author: SAM LONG
title: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan paves way for record 90,000 Wembley crowd at Joshua-Klitschko fight

persons.name: john walton/pa  mayor of london sadiq khan

organizations.name: transport for london and network rail

text:

Round one TKO, 1min 37secs Kevin Quigley/Daily Mail 15/19 Fight 15 vs Dillian Whyte 
Round seven KO, 1min 27secs Kevin Quigley/Daily Mail 16/19 Fight 16 vs Charles Martin 
Round two KO, 1min 32secs Richard Heathcote/Getty Images 17/19 Fight 17 vs Dominic Breazeale 
Round seven TKO, 1min 01secs Richard Heathcote/Getty Images 18/19 Fight 18 vs Eric Molina 
Round three TKO, 2min, 02secs Peter Byrne/PA Wire 19/19 Fight 19 vs Wladimir Klitschko 
April 29 2017 John Walton/PA 
Mayor of London Sadiq Khan has paved the way for Anthony Joshua 's heavyweight title fight against Wladimir Klitschko to be witnessed by a record crowd of 90,000 at Wembley Stadium . 
The highly-anticipated bout was announced in December following Joshua's successful second defence of his IBF title, with the WBA belt also set to be on the line. 
Wembley was subsequently confirmed as the venue for the April 29 clash but permission was originally granted for a capacity of 80,000. 
However, Khan has reaffirmed his commitment to help the capital stage the biggest sporting events by bringing together officials from Network Rail, Transport for London and Wembley Stadium to increase capacity by a further 10,000. 
More overground trains and London Underground services will be run to help transport fans away from the venue, with Jubilee and Metropolitan lines operating at an increased capacity. 
Network Rail have also agreed to temporarily postpone planned engineering works on the day of the fight and Khan is delighted a new post-war British boxing attendance record will be set when Joshua takes on Klitschko. Joshua vows not to be overawed by scale of Klitschko Wembley bout 
Khan said: “I can’t wait to see the fight of the year here in London and it’s fantastic that a post-war record crowd will get to watch it at a world-class venue like Wembley. 
“I’m delighted Transport for London and Network Rail have pulled out all the stops to make this happen so we can move 90,000 people around the capital quickly and safely. 
"Like me, they have recognised the importance to the capital of staging this epic showdown of the best two fighters in the heavyweight division and I look forward to our great city staging more great fights in the future.” 
Eddie Hearn - Joshua's Matchroom promoter - added: “I’m delighted that the capacity for Joshua vs Klitschko has been increased to 90,000 making it the biggest live gate of all time at the new Wembley stadium. Joshua to become superstar in 2017 as boxing prepares for huge fight 
"I want to thank Wembley, TfL and Brent Council and particularly the Mayor of London, Sadiq Khan, who has fought our corner to ensure a capacity crowd will get the opportunity to watch this event live in the capital." 
Joshua is unbeaten in 18 professional fights, having quickly progressed through the ranks since winning Gold at the London 2012 Olympics. 
Klitschko, meanwhile, ruled the heavyweight division for nine years before losing his belts to Tyson Fury in November 2015. More about:
